relationships.notes: Listed among the Twelve whom Jesus appoints and sends out, identified by his Zealot/Cananaean epithet within the commissioning narratives.
Named alongside Matthew the tax collector in the apostolic lists, highlighting the diverse social and political origins gathered by Jesus.
Remains in the Jerusalem upper room with Peter and the rest of the apostles after the ascension, awaiting the promised Spirit.

traits.listing_among_twelve: Named in the lists of the Twelve as Simon the Cananaean or Simon who was called the Zealot, distinguishing him from Simon Peter.
traits.epithet_meaning: His designation likely points to prior association with a zealous or nationalist movement, or to personal zeal, though the texts do not narrate any such activity.
traits.lack_of_individual_episodes: Receives no individual stories or sayings; his significance lies in being part of the diverse band of apostles that includes former tax collectors and possibly former revolutionaries.
traits.presence_in_post_easter_community: Included in the list of apostles gathered in Jerusalem awaiting the Spirit after the ascension.
